references.paper_title: Attribute-based classification for zero-shot visual object categorization
references.reason: This paper is foundational for zero-shot learning, introducing the concept of attribute-based classification for recognizing unseen objects.

references.paper_title: Write a classifier: Zero-shot learning using purely textual descriptions
references.reason: This paper explores a novel approach to zero-shot learning using only textual descriptions, significantly impacting the field's reliance on visual attributes.
This paper addresses the limitations of traditional zero-shot learning by introducing the concept of open-set recognition, a more realistic scenario where both seen and unseen classes are considered.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a large vision-language model pre-trained on a massive dataset, which substantially advanced zero-shot learning capabilities.

references.paper_title: Contrastive embedding for generalized zero-shot learning
references.reason: This paper presents a novel contrastive learning approach for generalized zero-shot learning, improving performance by aligning visual and linguistic features effectively.
